titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Deepdale Golf Club photograph album V1998.002
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-02T14:59-0500

did.abstract: Photograph album containing images of the Deepdale Glof Club course and clubhouse (interior and exterior), dating from circa 1955. The course is located in Manhasset, New York, on the north shore of Long Island. The album includes one photograph of President Dwight D. Eisenhower on the course. The album was created by Haynes Provost Studios.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Deepdale Golf Club photograph album, v1998.002; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The copyright status of the photographs has not has been established.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1998.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Deepdale Golf Club was established by William K. Vanderbilt II in 1924. It was constructed on the property of his summer home ("Lake Success") in Manhasset, New York, on the north shore of Long Island. It was designed by Charles Blair Macdonald, Seth Raynor, and Charles Banks. Due to the construction of the Long Island Expressway in 1954, the course was reestablished on the nearby W.R. Grace estate by Dick Wilson. The Grace Mansion served as the new clubhouse, and course was reopened in 1955.
Source: "History of the Golf Club." Deepdale Golf Club. Accessed December 17, 2015. http://www.deepdalegolfclub.com/history.html.
